titleStmt.title: R. Gudgell et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11087

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
To His Excellency
Govenor B Magoffin.

The Undersigned would respectfully represent That at the September Term 1861 of the Bath Circuit Court Two fines of $50. each were recovered against James Kernard for selling "liqour to a Minor" -- That the Minor was a young man who had been acting for himself apparent ^^ as of age, and further that he has the appearance of being at least 24 years of age instead of being a minor and well calculated to deceive the most vigilant -- We Believe that Mr Kernard had no design to violate the law, and that it is one of the cases claiming in good faith, your clemency --

J. A.
J. M. Richart
J A. J. Lee
S. C. Bascom
W Taylor
B. F. Trumbo
G, W, Thompson
Clay Lee
Joseph Morse
John M. Godby
J J Lightfoot
N P Comer
Jno Miller
John Trumbo Jr
Jacob Warner, Jr
R. Gudgell
C W Panasses
R. Coulthard
J H Richart
J. T. Hart
W. P. Carr
Wm Richards
W H T Mass
L Coleman
R M Conner
M A Daugherty
H H Ewing
George, Oakley
B. Hurt
R, L, Tipton
Jonas Warner
A Trumbo
Jno D Barry

Bath Cir Ct
James Kinard
v. } Petition to remit $100 fines
Gov of Ky.
Remitted
B. M_
Made out Jany 28" 62
